issue.title: Error loading quantum safe certificate into Chromium
issue.body: Hello, I am currently trying to use the quantum-safe Chromium (0.5.0) build as a client to connect to the OQS haproxy container using its default certificate generation settings (the default signature algorithm used is dilithium3 according to this page: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/tree/main/haproxy). I tried to load the CA certificate from the haproxy container into Chromium but got the following error: I have verified that I am able to use Curl with this certificate for authentication to access the haproxy, so it is not an issue with the certificate. It appears that I obtain this error when I try to install certificates that use quantum-safe digital signature algorithms. For example, making use of the OQS fork of OpenSSL contained within the Curl container, I run the following command with = dilithium2, dilithium3, RSA, and falcon512: docker run -v `pwd`:/opt/tmp -it openquantumsafe/curl openssl req -x509 -new -newkey -keyout /opt/tmp/CA.key -out /opt/tmp/CA.crt -nodes -subj "/CN=oqstest CA" -days 365 The certificates that used dilithium2, dilithium3, and falcon512 failed to load, but the certificate that used RSA loaded just fine. Any help is appreciated! Here is the certificate that I grabbed from within the haproxy container: -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- MIIVejCCCIWgAwIBAgIUAepY4WbwHzFTZHk5LX1YZEhPzzcwDQYLKwYBBAECggsH BgUwFTETMBEGA1UEAwwKb3FzdGVzdCBDQTAeFw0yMTA2MjIxNjAxMDdaFw0yMjA2 MjIxNjAxMDdaMBUxEzARBgNVBAMMCm9xc3Rlc3QgQ0Ewgge0MA0GCysGAQQBAoIL BwYFA4IHoQBVwCWhM80rjUCbrPOId2aPoiV3mfNDQoNXvieqvCCCRAz8HQUNLfY5 comment.body: @taylormadehdz : Any news on the above? I'd further suggest changing the title to "Add OQS to libnss" (tagged as future-work, help-wanted)

issue.title: Update KEM and Signature information table once liboqs YAML docsheets are available.
issue.body: Add "NIST Round" and "Specification Version" fields to https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/blob/OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable/oqs-template/generate-oid-nid-table.py once https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/892 is addressed.

comment.body: @xvzcf Would you have time to do this? Currently this is blocking https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/issues/83 -- which in turn is needed to generate a correct(ly documented) test server (which is due with the release of `liboqs v0.7.0`).

issue.title: undefined references to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_keypair`
issue.body:
I am compiling the liboqs using the waf/wscript building system for the `ave32-gcc` compiler.
Now I encounter the following errors during linking:

```
[218/220] Linking build/nanomind.elf
lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c.2.o: In function `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_new':
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_keypair'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_encaps'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_decaps'
```

I tried to search for the source file of the definition but I cannot find the implementation of these 3 funcitons.
A [search in the github repo](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/search?q=OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps) also only shows the 3 results.

```bash
> pwd
/home/simon/workspace/liboqs
> grep -rn . -e 'OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps'
./src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo976aes_params.h:29:#define crypto_kem_enc                OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem976aes.c:27:	kem->encaps = OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps;
Binary file ./build/lib/liboqs.a matches
./build/include/oqs/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/kem_frodokem976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/external/frodo976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem_mem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/kat_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/speed_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/example_kem matches
```

Where are those functions implemented?
The binary files in the build directory are of no use to me since I use a different compiler.

comment.body: I see, this lib is not meant to be built by any other autobuilder. I will try to add the avr-gcc compiler to the current CMakeFiles.

issue.title: undefined references to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_keypair`
issue.body:
I am compiling the liboqs using the waf/wscript building system for the `ave32-gcc` compiler.
Now I encounter the following errors during linking:

```
[218/220] Linking build/nanomind.elf
lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c.2.o: In function `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_new':
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_keypair'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_encaps'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_decaps'
```

I tried to search for the source file of the definition but I cannot find the implementation of these 3 funcitons.
A [search in the github repo](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/search?q=OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps) also only shows the 3 results.

```bash
> pwd
/home/simon/workspace/liboqs
> grep -rn . -e 'OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps'
./src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo976aes_params.h:29:#define crypto_kem_enc                OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem976aes.c:27:	kem->encaps = OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps;
Binary file ./build/lib/liboqs.a matches
./build/include/oqs/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/kem_frodokem976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/external/frodo976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem_mem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/kat_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/speed_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/example_kem matches
```

Where are those functions implemented?
The binary files in the build directory are of no use to me since I use a different compiler.

comment.body: I forked the project and will continue the integration of the `avr32-gcc` compiler (and perhaps also the `arm-none-eabi-gcc`) on separate branches. Are you at all interested in having this library ported to microcontroller platforms and possibly support it on the upstream branch?

issue.title: undefined references to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_keypair`
issue.body:
I am compiling the liboqs using the waf/wscript building system for the `ave32-gcc` compiler.
Now I encounter the following errors during linking:

```
[218/220] Linking build/nanomind.elf
lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c.2.o: In function `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_new':
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_keypair'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_encaps'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_decaps'
```

I tried to search for the source file of the definition but I cannot find the implementation of these 3 funcitons.
A [search in the github repo](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/search?q=OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps) also only shows the 3 results.

```bash
> pwd
/home/simon/workspace/liboqs
> grep -rn . -e 'OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps'
./src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo976aes_params.h:29:#define crypto_kem_enc                OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem976aes.c:27:	kem->encaps = OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps;
Binary file ./build/lib/liboqs.a matches
./build/include/oqs/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/kem_frodokem976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/external/frodo976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem_mem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/kat_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/speed_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/example_kem matches
```

Where are those functions implemented?
The binary files in the build directory are of no use to me since I use a different compiler.

comment.body: It is our goal to have support for the widest possible range of platforms, Yes. That said, our team may not have the required bandwidth and/or capabilities to support platforms we're not familiar with. However, if you'd volunteer to maintain embedded platform support directly within our project, I see no reason why we should not welcome that. Please be aware, though, that we very much rely on CI; thus, any contribution that you may provide should have a CI component ensuring the (new) platforms "keep ticking" (or we are automatically made aware what/if sth fails in the future).

comment.body: For the rest of 2021 i am funded by a research project where I need liboqs on avr32. I will certainly look into CMake and CI. I am open to maintaining what I added but time will tell what I can achieve.

issue.title: Sync with PQClean
issue.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Sync with PQClean https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/commit/6c1ea921ee4a06a6b50c742ca540bb9b5e51aee2. 

Related to #1058.

comment.body:
> The contents look good, but the documentation didn't get updated (git commit hash unchanged in docs/algorithms/sig/falcon.XXX): It seems to be necessary to manually run `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py` -> would it be an idea to trigger this when running `copy_from_upstream.py`?

Good catch, Michael. Fixed now.
